授業目的: The purpose of this course is for students to learn the basics of Canadian government and discuss political issues that will shape the future for young people in Canada and Japan.
到達目標:
Students will:
• Understand the basics of democratic government
• Discuss "hot" political issues in Canada and Japan: the COVID-19 pandemic; climate change and climate action; social equality; the status of women; immigration, diversity and inclusion; the rights of Indigenous (First) Canadians; sexual orientation; sex work.
• Learn how to write and present short “briefing notes” on political issues
授業方法: Learning activities include lectures by the Professor, student discussions and short student presentations. The Professor's presentation will be available on LUNA before each course session. The Professor's presentations will be available on LUNA before each course session to make it easier for students to understand and take notes.
